cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to arc northeast across AL/GA and move offshore the Carolina coast into the western Atlantic

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of Morgan City, LA to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same area as watch – East of Morgan City, LA to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast first, then interior AL/GA and eventually portions of the Carolinas coast
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: ATLANTA GA (closest site listed in wind-probability table; none were provided for VA)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible early next week, but tropical-storm-force winds are not expected at the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Virginia coast from this system
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to locally heavy rain possible 21–22 Jun as the remnant low passes offshore NC
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low-end risk of an isolated tornado in outer rainbands if they reach southeastern Virginia
